newsitem.title: BELGIUM: B.Midland says Lon-Brussels traffic up 4pct in '96.
newsitem.headline: B.Midland says Lon-Brussels traffic up 4pct in '96.

text.p: British Midland recorded four percent traffic growth last year on its London Heathrow to Brussels route, Chairman Sir Michael Bishop told a news conference on Thursday.

"The route Heathrow-Brussels is growing again. It's been largely unaffected by the Eurostar train," Bishop said in reference to the London-Brussels train service running through the Channel tunnel operated by Eurotunnel Plc.
"Even before the tunnel fire, our traffic to Brussels was growing again," he said, adding that last year saw a "quite satisfying" four percent growth.
Last November's fire in one of the Channel tunnels caused a partial shutdown and reduced services.
Bishop said he thought the point-to-point time taken on the train was still too long to threaten air services.
He also played down the threat of the no-frills service offered jointly on the route by Virgin Express and Sabena Sabena, the Belgian carrier owned 49.5 percent by Swissair.

"It's quite clear from experience so far that Virgin Express is a very different product to the one provided by British Midland and by our other competitors. The regular passengers are coming to both of us rather than going for the no-frills service," he said.
On Virgin's market share, Bishop said: "The volumes are going up but I imagine that the yields are very low."
